original: Magnusson, Adolf Hugo, fil. dr, se-mdnarielärare, Göteborg, f. 1/3/85 i Gottröra, Sthlms 1., av folkskoll. Johan M. o. Sofia Olsson. G. 11 m. Signe S tern er. Barn: Vi van f. 12, Kurt 15, ing., Gbg, Birgit 17, folkskoll., Gbg, Anna Stina 19, fil. mag., g. m. fil. lic. Ingvar Hansson, Lund. — Mog:ex. 04 o. folkskoll :ex. 06 i Upps., fil. kand. 13 o. fil. mag. 14 i Gbg, fil. hed :dr i Upps. 32. E. o. lär. v. Lidingö folksk. 06-07, vik. lär. v. Onsala h. folksk. 07-08, e. o. folkskoll. 08-09, ord. lär. v. Ghgs folks’k. 09, v. dess h. avd. 14-17, lär. v. Gbgs folksk :sem. övn :sk. s€d. 17. Resor: Torne lappm. 19 o. 21, Lycksele lappm. f. bot. stud. 24, Ös-terf. 22, H:fors 23, London o. Paris 25, Tyskl., Schweiz o. Itak 27, Tyskl., Österr. o. Ung. 29, H:fors o. Äbo 31 o. 32. Skr.: ett flertal avh. o. upps. ’särsk. betr. lavar i in- o. uti. facktidskr. RNO.
translated: Magnusson, Adolf Hugo, Ph.D., secondary school teacher, Gothenburg, b. 1/3/85 in Gottröra, Stockholm County, son of primary school teacher Johan M. and Sofia Olsson. Married on 11 March to Signe Sterner. Children: Ivan, b. 1912; Kurt, b. 1915, engineer, Gothenburg; Birgit, b. 1917, primary school teacher, Gothenburg; Anna Stina, b. 1919, Master of Arts, married to Ph.Lic. Ingvar Hansson, Lund. Completed 'mog' exam in 1904 and primary school teacher exam in 1906 in Uppsala, Bachelor of Arts in 1913 and Master of Arts in 1914 in Gothenburg, conferred Ph.D. in 1932 in Uppsala. Temporary teacher at Lidingö primary school 1906-1907, substitute teacher at Onsala h. primary school 1907-1908, temporary primary school teacher 1908-1909, regular teacher at Gothenburg folks'k. since 1909, at its higher department 1914-1917, teacher at Gothenburg primary school seminary practice school since 1917. Travels: Torne lappmark in 1919 and 1921, Lycksele lappmark for botanical studies in 1924, Österfärnebo in 1922, Helsinki in 1923, London and Paris in 1925, Germany, Switzerland, and Italy in 1927, Germany, Austria, and Hungary in 1929, Helsinki and Turku in 1931 and 1932. Publications: Several articles and papers, particularly regarding lichens in national and international scientific journals. Member of the Royal Swedish Society of Sciences.
